page.title: 04Darlington Housing: part 2
page.content:
well looked after. There are a few shops including newsagents, hairdressers and an ICI petrol station. The most interesting one was a dog-grooming parlour.
{ Station Road}is a little bit better. The houses are still terraced and have small front gardens. At the end of the road is{North Road Station {and museum. }The station is an "open station" and was deserted. The walls are covered with graffiti and the rails and platform are strewn with rubbish. The museum was also deserted. People have to pay to get in. The rooms are full of grandfather clocks and things used in old stations. {Catherine Ruddock}
